item.title: 'Smart' Pill Bottles Aren't Enough To Help The Medicine Go Down
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Lots of people forget to take their medicine on time. Now firms are selling "smart" pill bottles that send patients reminders through the internet. But maybe the real problem isn't forgetfulness.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Lots of people forget to take their medicine on time. Now firms are selling "smart" pill bottles that send patients reminders through the internet. But maybe the real problem isn't forgetfulness. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/22/538153337/smart-pill-bottles-arent-enough-to-help-the-medicine-go-down

item.title: Hospitals Could Do More For Survivors Of Opioid Overdoses, Study Suggests
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Researchers say hospitals are missing an opportunity to help people with opioid addiction get into treatment by not doing enough when they show up in emergency rooms after an overdose.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Researchers say hospitals are missing an opportunity to help people with opioid addiction get into treatment by not doing enough when they show up in emergency rooms after an overdose. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/22/545115225/hospitals-could-do-more-for-survivors-of-opioid-overdoses-study-suggests

item.title: How To Tell If Watching The Eclipse Damaged Your Eyes
item.description: August 21, 2017 - If you heeded all the warnings, you're likely fine. But spots or blurred vision that shows up 12 hours later or the next day might be a sign that the sun's direct rays permanently hurt the retina.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - If you heeded all the warnings, you're likely fine. But spots or blurred vision that shows up 12 hours later or the next day might be a sign that the sun's direct rays permanently hurt the retina. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/21/545129631/how-to-tell-if-you-ve-damaged-your-eyes-watching-the-eclipse

item.title: PHOTOS: The Day The Eclipse Came To America
item.description:
August 21, 2017 - A total solar eclipse crossed the entire country earlier today. Many Americans were treated to a rare and stunning view.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/21/545083434/photos-the-day-the-eclipse-came-to-america
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - A total solar eclipse crossed the entire country earlier today. Many Americans were treated to a rare and stunning view. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/21/545083434/photos-the-day-the-eclipse-came-to-america

item.title: Total Solar Eclipse Travels From Oregon To South Carolina
item.description: August 21, 2017 - From coast to coast, a total solar eclipse crossed the United States on Monday. Fourteen states were in the path of total darkness, while a partial eclipse was visible in other parts of the country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - From coast to coast, a total solar eclipse crossed the United States on Monday. Fourteen states were in the path of total darkness, while a partial eclipse was visible in other parts of the country. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/545071440/total-solar-eclipse-travels-from-oregon-to-south-carolina

item.title: Americans View Astronomical Show As Total Solar Eclipse Sweeps Across U.S.
item.description: August 21, 2017 - The total solar eclipse swept across the country on Monday from Oregon to South Carolina. A partial eclipse was also visible in other parts of the U.S. All Things Considered checked in with some listeners who witnessed the eclipse.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - The total solar eclipse swept across the country on Monday from Oregon to South Carolina. A partial eclipse was also visible in other parts of the U.S. All Things Considered checked in with some listeners who witnessed the eclipse. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/545071403/americans-view-astronomical-show-as-total-solar-eclipse-sweeps-across-u-s

item.title: Darkness Falls Across The Land As Total Solar Eclipse Passes Over U.S.
item.description: August 21, 2017 - It was dark during the day on Monday as the total solar eclipse traveled across the U.S. from Oregon to South Carolina. NPR heard from some people who witnessed the astronomical show.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - It was dark during the day on Monday as the total solar eclipse traveled across the U.S. from Oregon to South Carolina. NPR heard from some people who witnessed the astronomical show. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/545071331/darkness-falls-across-the-land-as-total-solar-eclipse-passes-over-u-s

item.title: States Work To Help Marijuana Industry Reduce Power Costs
item.description: August 21, 2017 - Growing marijuana takes a lot of energy, which comes into conflict with state efforts to reduce greenhouse gases. Now, some places are helping the pot industry to become more energy efficient.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - Growing marijuana takes a lot of energy, which comes into conflict with state efforts to reduce greenhouse gases. Now, some places are helping the pot industry to become more energy efficient. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/545071324/states-work-to-help-marijuana-industry-reduce-power-costs

item.title: People Travel Across The Country To Get A Glimpse Of The Solar Eclipse
item.description: August 21, 2017 - Americans are traveling to cities, towns and campsites across the country to get a good view of the Great American Eclipse. All Things Considered heard from a few of them as they witnessed eclipse in totality.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - Americans are traveling to cities, towns and campsites across the country to get a good view of the Great American Eclipse. All Things Considered heard from a few of them as they witnessed eclipse in totality. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/545071307/people-travel-across-the-country-to-get-a-glimpse-of-the-solar-eclipse

item.title: Can Anyone, Even Walmart, Stem The Heat-Trapping Flood Of Nitrogen On Farms?
item.description: August 21, 2017 - Walmart has promised big cuts in emissions of greenhouse gases. To meet that goal, though, the giant retailer may have to persuade farmers to use less fertilizer. It won't be easy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - Walmart has promised big cuts in emissions of greenhouse gases. To meet that goal, though, the giant retailer may have to persuade farmers to use less fertilizer. It won't be easy. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/21/544229458/can-anyone-even-walmart-stem-the-heat-trapping-flood-of-nitrogen-on-farms

item.title: WATCH: Experts Weigh In On America's Solar Eclipse
item.description: August 21, 2017 - NASA was on eclipse watch as the moon blocked the sun in a celestial coincidence Monday. A segment of the country from Oregon to South Carolina was in the so-called path of totality.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - NASA was on eclipse watch as the moon blocked the sun in a celestial coincidence Monday. A segment of the country from Oregon to South Carolina was in the so-called path of totality. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/544524025/watch-experts-weigh-in-on-americas-solar-eclipse

item.title: Eclipse Map: Tracking The Astronomical Show
item.description: August 21, 2017 - A total solar eclipse began in Oregon and made its way to South Carolina starting at 1:16 p.m. ET. Take a look at where the eclipse was as it traveled across the United States.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - A total solar eclipse began in Oregon and made its way to South Carolina starting at 1:16 p.m. ET. Take a look at where the eclipse was as it traveled across the United States. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/544244965/eclipse-map-tracking-where-the-astronomical-show

item.title: Replay Live Coverage: Follow The Solar Eclipse
item.description: August 21, 2017 - It was dark during the day as a total solar eclipse traveled from Oregon to South Carolina. See highlights from the phenomenon's journey along with NPR journalists and others experiencing the eclipse.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - It was dark during the day as a total solar eclipse traveled from Oregon to South Carolina. See highlights from the phenomenon's journey along with NPR journalists and others experiencing the eclipse. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/21/544239796/live-coverage-follow-the-solar-eclipse

item.title: In Illinois, This College Town Won't Be Eclipsed By August's Celestial Event
item.description: August 20, 2017 - A town of 26,000 will more than double in size as the Great American Eclipse takes place in August. From the local state university to longtime bakery, people are getting ready for it to get dark.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 20, 2017 - A town of 26,000 will more than double in size as the Great American Eclipse takes place in August. From the local state university to longtime bakery, people are getting ready for it to get dark. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/20/538521952/in-illinois-this-college-town-wont-be-eclipsed-by-augusts-celestial-event

item.title: Words You'll Hear: Eclipse Cheap Seats
item.description: August 20, 2017 - A total eclipse sweeps the U.S. on Monday. But most will see a partial eclipse. The question is: Is an 80 or even a 90 percent eclipse worth it? Or should people make the extra effort to see totality?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 20, 2017 - A total eclipse sweeps the U.S. on Monday. But most will see a partial eclipse. The question is: Is an 80 or even a 90 percent eclipse worth it? Or should people make the extra effort to see totality? http://www.npr.org/2017/08/20/544886650/words-youll-hear-eclipse-cheap-seats
